Tk_Gui

Class Tk_Graph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • Tk_Gui.Tk_Graph<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.Scrollable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tk_BarGraph

    public class Tk_Graph<T>
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements javax.swing.Scrollable

    A somewhat generic graph. This graph class simply draws the axes, and if Tk_ChartEntry elements are added to it, it will call their paint methods as appropriate.

    Fixme: We probably want to subclass this more general graph to the specific type we use for the Time Keeper.
    Author:
    michaelwebster
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Tk_Graph

        public Tk_Graph(Tk_GraphDirection gd,
        long height_on_screen,
        long start_range,
        long end_range,
        long width_on_screen,
        long start_domain,
        long end_domain,
        long big_y_ticks,
        long small_y_ticks,
        long big_x_ticks,
        long small_x_ticks,
        java.lang.String x_label,
        java.lang.String y_label,
        Tk_Converter<T,java.lang.Long> converter)
        Create the Tk_Graph.
        Parameters:
        gd - The direction of growth.
        height_on_screen - The height of the graph component.
        start_range - The beginning of the y-axis range of values.
        end_range - The end of the y-axis range of values.
        width_on_screen - The width of the graph component.
        start_domain - The beginning of the x-axis' domain of values.
        end_domain - The end of the x-axis' domain of values.
        big_y_ticks - The distance between big ticks on the y-axis.
        small_y_ticks - The distance between small ticks on the y-axis.
        big_x_ticks - The distance between big ticks on the x-axis.
        small_x_ticks - The distance between small ticks on the y-axis.
        x_label - The label for the x axis.
        y_label - The label for the y axis.
        converter - A value converter.

      • getHeightBuffer

      • getComponentHeight

        public long getComponentHeight()

      • getComponentWidth

        Returns:
